Summarizing Regression Simulations

summary method for class "regsim"

# S3 method for regsim
summary(object, intercept = FALSE, detail = FALSE,
  rotate = FALSE, ...)

Arguments

object

an object of class "regsim", usually obtained by calling the regsim function.
intercept

include intercept in output
detail

print detail format
rotate

rotate covariates vertically
...

additional arguments passed to class-specific functions

Examples

library(regsim)

model <- lm(mpg ~ wt + cyl, data = mtcars)
sim <- regsim(model, list(wt = seq(1, 5), cyl = mean(mtcars$cyl)))
summary(sim, detail = TRUE, rotate = TRUE)
#>     Profile 1
#> wt     1.0000
#> cyl    6.1875
#> 
#>       mean       sd     2.5%      50%    97.5%
#> p1 27.1341 1.777956 23.79492 27.11576 30.72753
#> ------------------------------------------------
#> 
#>     Profile 2
#> wt     2.0000
#> cyl    6.1875
#> 
#>        mean       sd     2.5%      50%    97.5%
#> p2 23.96384 1.045917 21.94068 23.92788 26.09904
#> ------------------------------------------------
#> 
#>     Profile 3
#> wt     3.0000
#> cyl    6.1875
#> 
#>        mean        sd     2.5%      50%    97.5%
#> p3 20.79358 0.4807214 19.91368 20.78462 21.72791
#> ------------------------------------------------
#> 
#>     Profile 4
#> wt     4.0000
#> cyl    6.1875
#> 
#>        mean        sd     2.5%    50%    97.5%
#> p4 17.62332 0.7566893 16.18013 17.605 19.13037
#> ------------------------------------------------
#> 
#>     Profile 5
#> wt     5.0000
#> cyl    6.1875
#> 
#>        mean       sd     2.5%      50%    97.5%
#> p5 14.45306 1.455472 11.64084 14.46362 17.34719
#> ------------------------------------------------
#>
